newsitem.title: USA: IPO HIGHLIGHTS - Hamilton Bancorp sees gains.
newsitem.headline: IPO HIGHLIGHTS - Hamilton Bancorp sees gains.

text.p: Shares of Hamilton Bancorp made a solid debut on Wednesday, opening with a 1-1/4 premium at 16-3/4, rising to 17-1/4, and then settling back in midday trading at the opening price.

The number of shares on offer was increased to 2.4 million from the two million originally stipulated. Each share priced at $15.50, towards the upper end of the $14 to $16 pricing range, in a deal lead-managed by Oppenheimer & Co.
Miami, Fla.-based Hamilton provides global trade finance, focusing on trade between South and Central America, the Caribbean and the United States.

Asia Pacific Wire & Cable Corp Ltd's shares rose a modest 1/8 of a point after pricing at $12 a share, well below the expected range of $14 to $16. The number of shares on the deal was raised to 3.4 million from 3.2 million.
The Singapore-based manufacturer of wire and cable products had filed for an IPO back in November, but had postponed the deal due to prevailing market conditions.
BT Securities was lead underwriter on the deal.
